source.8b7c4d14:
#Replace missing values of Categorical variables by mode
mode1=data["Alley"].mode().values[0]
mode2=data["MasVnrType"].mode().values[0]
mode3=data["BsmtQual"].mode().values[0]
mode4=data["BsmtCond"].mode().values[0]
mode5=data["BsmtExposure"].mode().values[0]
mode6=data["BsmtFinType1"].mode().values[0]
mode7=data["BsmtFinType2"].mode().values[0]
mode8=data["FireplaceQu"].mode().values[0]
mode9=data["GarageType"].mode().values[0]
mode10=data["GarageFinish"].mode().values[0]
mode11=data["GarageQual"].mode().values[0]
mode12=data["GarageCond"].mode().values[0]
mode13=data["PoolQC"].mode().values[0]
mode14=data["Fence"].mode().values[0]
mode15=data["MiscFeature"].mode().values[0]
mode16=data["LotFrontage"].mode().values[0]

data["Alley"]=data["Alley"].replace(np.nan,mode1)
data["MasVnrType"]=data["MasVnrType"].replace(np.nan,mode2)
data["BsmtQual"]=data["BsmtQual"].replace(np.nan,mode3)
data["BsmtCond"]=data["BsmtCond"].replace(np.nan,mode4)
data["BsmtExposure"]=data["BsmtExposure"].replace(np.nan,mode5)
data["BsmtFinType1"]=data["BsmtFinType1"].replace(np.nan,mode6)
data["BsmtFinType2"]=data["BsmtFinType2"].replace(np.nan,mode7)
data["FireplaceQu"]=data["FireplaceQu"].replace(np.nan,mode8)
data["GarageType"]=data["GarageType"].replace(np.nan,mode9)
data["GarageFinish"]=data["GarageFinish"].replace(np.nan,mode10)
data["GarageQual"]=data["GarageQual"].replace(np.nan,mode11)
data["GarageCond"]=data["GarageCond"].replace(np.nan,mode12)
data["PoolQC"]=data["PoolQC"].replace(np.nan,mode13)
data["Fence"]=data["Fence"].replace(np.nan,mode14)
data["MiscFeature"]=data["MiscFeature"].replace(np.nan,mode15)
data["LotFrontage"]=data["LotFrontage"].replace(np.nan,mode16)

source.3aaf95ac:
def remove_outlier(col):
    sorted(col)
    Q1,Q3=col.quantile([0.25,0.75])
    IQR=Q3-Q1
    lower_range=Q1-(1.5*IQR)
    upper_range=Q3+(1.5*IQR)
    return lower_range,upper_range

from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
std_scale=StandardScaler()

source.cdfb1de3:
IMPUTATION OF MISSING VALUES :
Missing Values are identified in both Numerical and Categorical values inorder to prevent reduction in Power/fit of model and bias .
source.32bb7f2d: In order to obtain an accurate prediction , Ensemble learning method - Random Forest Regressor is used
source.80002d8b:
REMOVAL OF OUTLIERS:
Ouliers provide wide variability of the data which decreases statistical power of the model .
Removal of Outliers is a must to understand the actual target population and also due to their negative impacts such as Outliers may be incorrectly entered or measured data or their presence may produce misleading interpretations and Outliers may produce associations between variables which otherwise is not present.
source.3349dc7b:
EXPLORATORY DATA ANALYSIS :
1)Univariate Analysis of Numerical Features to Understand the impact of extreme values in each of the numerical feature .
2)Univariate Analysis of Categorical Features to Understand the impact of each of the categories under a given categorical feature.
3)Bivariate Analysis to understand the positive or negative association each feature has on the other.
source.a654752f: To check and remove duplicate values is a must since presence of Duplicate values are extreme case of Nonrandom Sampling which otherwise will lead to overfitting of the model.
source.a96d2f5e:
IMPORTANCE OF CORRELATION EFFECTS:
1)Correlation indicates the presence of causal effects among variables
2)Correlation directs to identify the underlying factors which cause the variability in the data
3)Correlation helps us to understand the need of data transformation and need to remove non-linearity
source.6f7d0933:
List of Methods Executed :
1)Loading the dataset
2)Data Visualization
3)Data Preprocessing : 
* Imputation of Missing Values
* Removal of Outliers 
* Standardization of Numerical Variables 
* Encoding of Categorical Variables

4)Feature Engineering
5)Solving the Problem for the given Objective
source.bb29bbf8: Due to presence of more categorical variables as compared to Numerical Variables and to avoid overfitting of the data , simple Label encoding method is used.
source.43c6c640:
IMPORTANCE OF STANDARDIZATION:
1)If the numerical data is not standardized ,there is bias caused due to distance 
between the features specifically larger numerical values
2)To uniform the data into a single format which is calculated based on the z-score which nullifies the effect of mean and calculates standard deviation of each of the feature to 1
3)Impact of Outlier is drastically reduced by standardization of variables
source.e8d3962f: Missing Values found in Categorical Variables are replaced by the category which has the highest frequency.
source.8469c13e: Objective : To predict sale price of the house based on the Numerical and Categorical features present in the dataset . The dataset consist of 79 explanatory features in total describing the houses in Ames,Iowa.
